title: Questerre updates PX Energy transaction
description: THIS NEWS RELEASE IS NOT FOR DISSEMINATION OR DISTRIBUTION IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA TO UNITED STATES NEWSWIRE SERVICES OR UNITED STATES PERSONS CALGARY, Alberta, Aug. 25, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) --
summary: Questerre Energy Corporation (TSX,OSE:QEC) has updated the status of its proposed acquisition of Parana Xisto SA (PX Energy), a privately held oil shale production and refining company based in southern Brazil. The acquisition will be completed through acquisition of shares from PX Energy's indirect parent companies, Forbes & Manhattan Resources Inc. and Forbes Participaҫões Ltda. Michael Binnion, President & Chief Executive Officer of Questerry, stated that the company's top priority is completing due diligence on the Acquisition to ensure an accretive transaction for shareholders. Completion of the Acquisition is subject to several conditions including satisfactory due diligence review, board approval, standard regulatory approvals, and third-party approvals.
shortSummary: Questerre Energy Corporation updates its proposed acquisition of Parana Xisto SA, focusing on liquidity, while continuing negotiations with bondholders to ensure value.

argos_summary: Questerre Energy reports progress on its proposed acquisition of Parana Xisto SA, noting that due diligence confirms operational compliance and growth plans but also reveals a need for additional liquidity and ongoing discussions with bondholders and convertible note holders. The company stresses the strategic value of PX Energy’s oil‑shale and refining assets, while acknowledging that the deal’s completion depends on regulatory, shareholder, and third‑party approvals. Forward‑looking statements outline risks such as failure to close, market volatility, and potential loss of key personnel.
